p: The water vapor barrier properties of alginate films were intended to be improved with the addition of other gel-forming biopolymers. Parris, Coffin, Joubran, and Pessen [ 81] developed alginate-milk based materials (i.e., whole or non-fat milk, whey, sodium caseinate). Films containing whole milk had decreased WVP up to 35% [ 81]. Likewise, Coughlan, Shaw, Kerry, and Kerry [ 221] have demonstrated that films formed from alginate-whey protein complexes had lower WVP. Rhim, Wu, Weller, and Schnepf [ 220] found that up to 10% PGA addition decreased the WVP of soy protein isolate films. Han and Wang [ 143] evaluated the WVP of sodium alginate-CMC films containing pyrogallic acid.
